alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Floyd; Grayson; Patrick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 7:28AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwest North Carolina and southwest Virginia including southwest Floyd, Southern Carroll and southeast Grayson counties thorugh 815 AM EDT... At 727 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pipers Gap to near Burch to near Harmony. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Airy... Galax... Elkin... Fairview... Flat Rock... Yadkinville... and Hillsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
